thread.title: England Now Eighth In World Rugby Rankings
thread.title_full: England Now Eighth In World Rugby Rankings

title: England Now Eighth In World Rugby Rankings
text:
England Now Eighth In World Rugby Rankings 11:55,   Share by email England have dropped to eighth in the world rankings following their Rugby World Cup exit. 
The latest rankings, released by World Rugby, show Stuart Lancaster's side have dropped to their lowest ever position after they became the first ever host nation to exit the World Cup without reaching the knockout stages. 
England had already fallen to sixth following their loss to Wales but a further defeat to Australia last weekend has seen them fall a further two places. 
If England were to fall any further it would leave them at risk of being placed into the third group of seeds when the next World Cup draw takes place. 
It was a similar scenario that saw Wales placed in the same pool as England and Australia for this World Cup when the draw was made back in December 2012 - although World Rugby have already indicated the draw for RWC 2019 will be made closer to the tournament. 
Australia's victory has moved them up a place behind New Zealand to second with Wales down a place to third. 
South Africa (4th), France (6th) and Argentina (7th) are all also up one place while - outside the top 10 - Samoa have dropped to their lowest ever ranking of 15.
